meanings.sent1: The candy was gummier than expected, making it hard to chew.
meanings.sent2: Her hands felt gummier after playing with the sticky slime.
meanings.sent3: The gummier texture of the glue made it challenging to stick the pieces together.
meanings.sent4: The humid weather made the air feel gummier, like walking through a sticky cloud.
meanings.sent5: The gummier surface of the sticker ensured it stayed firmly in place.

meanings.definition: Having a sticky or adhesive quality.
meanings.sent1: The tape became gummier as it aged, losing its stickiness.
meanings.sent2: The gummier side of the tape adhered well to the paper.
meanings.sent3: The gummier substance on the floor made it tricky to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a gummier effect on him, sticking in his mind long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The gummier nature of the glue made it perfect for crafting projects.

meanings.sent1: The spilled juice became gummier as it dried on the table.
meanings.sent2: The gummier texture of the dough made it easier to shape into cookies.
meanings.sent3: The gummier consistency of the syrup made the pancakes extra sweet.
meanings.sent4: The gummier surface of the sticker clung tightly to the notebook cover.
meanings.sent5: The gummier side of the tape stuck firmly to the cardboard box.
